discourse_list.title: SEC Chair is worried that the crypto bill undermines financial protections

content.content: This is a somewhat interesting take on the U.S. crypto bill making headlines. It seems Gary Gensler, the SEC Chair, is a little upset about this bill. I wonder if the SEC is upset that the CFTC will take away some power from the SEC. Gensler said: “We don’t want our current stock exchanges, mutual funds, or public companies to, sort of inadvertently by a stroke of a pen, say ‘you know what, I want to be non-compliant as well, I want to be outside of this regime that I think has been quite a benefit to investors and economic growth over the last 90 years.’” I bet he will have more to say as the bill moves along.    Cointelegraph    SEC boss worries crypto bill undermines financial protections SEC Chair Gary Gensler is concerned about undermining existing investor protections due to a recent bipartisan bill.

Let’s wait for Defi to develop faster than regulation can regulate, increasing the degree of decentralization lately is extremely vital, a financial system absent of the human factor in terms of economic management is what we all need, because the human fails and corrupts.

And the SEC makes it even more confusing SEC.gov | On the Spot: Remarks at “Regulatory Transparency Project Conference on Regulating the New Crypto Ecosystem: Necessary Regulation or Crippling Future Innovation?”
